de.boereck.matcher.function.testable

Interface TestableFunction<I,O>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of input to function
    O - type of output of function
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<I,O>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CurryableFunction<I,O>, ThrowingFunction<I,O,E>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface TestableFunction<I,O>
extends Function<I,O>
    Function that provides more combinators than Function. Especially interesting are function thenTest(Predicate) to create a predicate based on the output of the function and the filter methods (filter(Class) and filter(Predicate)) to create a function providing an Optional, depending if the output of this function passes the given filter criterion or not.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        apply, identity

    • Method Detail

      • thenTest

        default AdvPredicate<I> thenTest(Predicate<? super O> test)
                          throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function first executing this function and then calling a test predicate on the result of this function.

        If this function or test will throw an exception when called by the returned predicate, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned predicate. If this function throws an exception the predicate test will not be evaluated.

        Parameters:
        test - predicate that will be used on the result of this function by the returned predicate. Must not be null
        Returns:
        predicate calling this function on its input and call predicate test with the output. The result of the call to test will be returned as the result.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

      • optional

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> optional()
        Provides a function that first calls this function with its input and then Optional.ofNullable(Object) with the result and returns the resulting optional.

        The difference to nullAware() is that the input to the function will not be checked for null, which is don in nullAware().

        If during the call of the returned method the call to this method throws an exception, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned method.

        Returns:
        function wrapping the result of this function into an optional.

      • andThen

        default <V> TestableFunction<I,V> andThen(Function<? super O,? extends V> after)
                                   throws NullPointerException
        Specified by:
        andThen in interface Function<I,O>
        Throws:

        default <V> TestableFunction<V,O> compose(Function<? super V,? extends I> before)
        Specified by:

      • thenDo

        default Consumer<I> thenDo(Consumer<? super O> consumer)
                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that will take an input, call this function with it, and then call the given consumer with the result.

        If this function or consumer will throw an exception when called by the returned consumer, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned consumer. If this function throws an exception consumer will not be evaluated.

        Parameters:
        consumer - will be called by the returned consumer with the result of applying this function on its input.
        Returns:
        Consumer calling this function with its input and calling consumer with the result. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if consumer is null.

      • filter

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> filter(Predicate<? super O> test)
                            throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will call this function with its input and then check if the output fulfills predicate test. If the predicate is fulfilled (returned true), an optional containing the output if this function will be returned; if the predicate is not fulfilled, an empty optional will be returned.

        If this function or test will throw an exception when called by the returned function, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned function. If this function throws an exception the predicate test will not be evaluated.

        Parameters:
        test - predicate checking if the result of this function should be returned in an optional by the returned function, or if an empty optional should be returned.
        Returns:
        function filtering the result of this function, based on predicate test.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

      • filter

        default <R> OptionalMapper<I,R> filter(Class<R> clazz)
                                throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will call this function with its input and then check if the output is instance of clazz. If the object is instance of clazz, an optional containing the output if this function will be returned; if not, an empty optional will be returned.

        If this function will throw an exception when called by the returned function, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned function.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Type the output of this function is checked for in the returned function
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class the output of this function is checked for in the returned function
        Returns:
        function filtering the result of this function, based on the type of the output object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if clazz is null.

      • requires

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> requires(Predicate<? super I> precondition)
        Returns a function that will first check if its input fulfills precondition and if so returns an optional holding the result of calling this function with the input. If the precondition is not fulfilled, an empty optional will be returned without evaluating this function. Be aware that the returned function will yield an empty optional in two cases:
        • If the precondition is not fulfilled
        • If this function returns a null value

        If either this function or precondition will throw an exception when called by the returned function, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned function. If predicate throws an exception this function will not be called.

        Parameters:
        precondition - will be used in the returned function to check weather or not to call this function.
        Returns:
        function using precondition to decide weather or not to call this function with its input and return the result of that call.

      • nullAware

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> nullAware()
        This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this TestableFunction and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty Optional will be returned. So effectively null checks will be performed on input and output of the function. Exceptions being thrown during the execution of this TestableFunction will also be thrown at the caller of the returned function.

        The difference to optional() is that the input to the function be checked for null, which is not done in optional().

        Returns:
        function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this TestableFunction and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty Optional will be returned.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> withCatch()
        The returned function will execute this TestableFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned as an Optional. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty Optional in this case. It is recommended to handle the exception, e.g. by using method <E extends Throwable> withCatch(Class<E>, Consumer<E>) or withCatch(Consumer<Exception>) instead. It cannot be distinguished if the function executed successfully and returned null, or an exception occurred. In both cases an empty Optional is returned.
        Returns:
        function that will execute this TestableFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty Optional in this case.

      • withCatch

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalMapper<I,O> withCatch(Class<E> clazz,
                                                            Consumer<E> handler)
        The returned function will execute this TestableFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an throwable of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the Exception; the function will return an empty Optional in this case. Throwables of other types will be re-thrown. From the result it cannot be distinguished if the function executed successfully and returned null, or an exception occurred. In both cases an empty Optional is returned. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of throwable to be caught
        Parameters:
        clazz - type of throwable to be caught
        handler - consumer handling the throwable
        Returns:
        function that will execute this TestableFunction and potentially handling exceptions of type clazz with handler. After handling exceptions, the function will return an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler or handler is null.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> withCatch(Consumer<Exception> handler)
        The returned function will execute this TestableFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty Optional in this case. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        handler - will handle exceptions being thrown during the execution of this TestableFunction
        Returns:
        function execution this TestableFunction and if execution performs without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty Optional in this case.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler is null.

      • recoverWith

        default TestableFunction<I,O> recoverWith(Function<? super Throwable,O> recovery)
        Returns a function executing this TestableFunction and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty Optional should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        recovery - method providing a regular result value if the TestableFunction throws an exception.
        Returns:
        function executing this TestableFunction and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty Optional should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if recovery is null.

      • recoverWith

        default <E extends Throwable> TestableFunction<I,O> recoverWith(Class<E> clazz,
                                                                Function<? super E,O> recovery)
        Returns a function executing this TestableFunction and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        recovery - function recovering from an exception providing a regular value to return from the returned function.
        Returns:
        function executing this TestableFunction and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or recovery is null.
